engine.agent
Class Agent

java.lang.Object
  engine.agent.Agent
All Implemented Interfaces:
TReceiver
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinAgent, ConveyorAgent, ConveyorAgent, ConveyorAgent, ConveyorAgent, ConveyorAgentEdward, ConveyorAgentWithTruck, LeftSideMachineAgent, LeftSidePreMachineConveyorAgent, LeftSidePreShuttleConveyorAgent, MachineAgent, MachineAgentEdward, PopUpAgent, PopUpAgent, RobotAgent, SensorAgent, WorkStationAgent
public abstract class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
implements TReceiver

Superclass for all threaded Agents. Agents have a thread devoted to their scheduler and subclasses must override pickAndExecuteAnAction(). They can also register with transducers

Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Return agent name for messages. Default is to return java instance name, unless the name is specified.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the name

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

setTracePanel

public void setTracePanel(TracePanel tracePanel)
Sets the TracePanel

pickAndExecuteAnAction

public abstract boolean pickAndExecuteAnAction()
Agents must implement this scheduler to perform any actions appropriate for the current state. Will be called whenever a state change has occurred, and will be called repeated as long as it returns true.

Returns:
true if some action was executed that might have changed the state.

eventFired

public abstract void eventFired(TChannel channel,
                                TEvent event,
                                java.lang.Object[] args)
Agents must implement this method in order to communicate with the transducer. This allows them to listen to events fired by the front end. NOTE: All implementations of this method should be synchronized!

Specified by:
eventFired in interface TReceiver
Parameters:
channel - the channel the event was fired on
event - the event type
args - any arguments the message needs

startThread

public void startThread()
Start agent scheduler thread. Should be called once at init time.

stopAgent

public void stopAgent()
Stop agent thread. To be used only in special circumstances. To pause an Agent during execution, call Agent.setPowerState() instead.
